tooltips.avgConfirmationTime: The average confirmation time is calculated locally on the node. If the node is restarted or in degraded condition, the average confirmation time might be higher than the rest of the network.
tooltips.circulatingSupply: The amount of coins that are in circulation.
tooltips.transactionFees: Unlike any other cryptocurrencies Paw transactions are fee-less, forever.
tooltips.bitcoinTransactionFees: This value have no impact on the PAW network, it is solely for comparison purpose. It represents the sum of transaction fees the Bitcoin users are paying to the miners to get their transaction accepted on the Bitcoin network.
tooltips.cps: Confirmations Per Second. The rate of confirmed blocks (send or receive) on the PAW network. It is sampled over the last minute locally on the node. If the node is restarted or in a degraded condition, the CPS value might be higher or lower than the actual average on the network while the node syncs and reconnects with the other nodes.
tooltips.votingWeight: An account with a minimum of {{minWeight}} PAW or >= 0.1% of the online voting weight delegated to it is required to get the Principal Representative status. When configured on a node which is voting, the votes it produces will be rebroadcasted by other nodes to who receive them, helping the network reach consensus more quickly.
tooltips.pending: A transaction state where a block sending funds was published and confirmed by the network, but a matching block receiving those funds has not yet been sent or confirmed by the receiver.
tooltips.nakamotoCoefficient: The Nakamoto coefficient is a way to quantify the decentralization of a blockchain or other decentralized system. It's the number of entities you need to compromise at least one essential subsystem. For Paw, more than {{onlineWeightQuorumPercent}}% of the online voting weight from principal representatives would have to be compromised.
tooltips.representatives: To optimize performances, only accounts with voting weight >= 1000 PAW are considered but normally any account with > 0 voting weight, but < 0.1% of the online voting weight.
tooltips.principalRepresentatives: An account with a minimum of {{principalRepresentativeMinWeight}} PAW or >= 0.1% of the online voting weight delegated to it is required to get the Principal Representative status. When configured on a node which is voting, the votes it produces will be rebroadcasted by other nodes to who receive them, helping the network reach consensus more quickly.
tooltips.onlinePrincipalRepresentatives: Online representative accounts that have voted recently.
tooltips.lastTransaction: Last send transaction from any of the {{totalAccounts}} accounts.
tooltips.largeTransactions: Only send transactions of 10,000 PAW or more are temporarily saved for one week.
tooltips.knownExchangeBalance: Exclude {{knownExchangeList}} from the distribution chart. Those accounts combined holds {{knownExchangeBalance}} PAW
tooltips.unchecked: Blocks (transactions) that have been downloaded but not yet processed by the Paw node. The node software downloads all bocks from other nodes as unchecked, processes them and adds to block count, confirms the frontier blocks for each account, and then marks them as cemented.
tooltips.cemented: When a specific node marks a confirmed transaction as locally irreversible by setting the account's confirmation height (in the node database) to the now higher block height of the confirmed transaction. Cementing is a node-level operation.
tooltips.unknownLastTransaction: Transaction dates were introduced in February 2019. Prior to that date, the transaction times were not recorded locally on the nodes. The reason why the last transaction date is unknown is because it was confirmed before the dates were recorded or before the PawLooker node was in service.
tooltips.confirmationHeight: A number stored in the local node database that represents the highest (most recent) confirmed block in an account chain. Related to (but different from) block height.
tooltips.blockHeight: A local integer value that represents the order of a block in an account chain. For example, the 15th block in an account would have a block height of 15. Related to (but different from) confirmation height.
tooltips.bookmarks: {{type, capitalize}} bookmarks are saved on your device. You can manage your known {{type}}s by giving them aliases.
tooltips.groupByEntities: Regroup all voting weight that is split into different principal representatives into single entities. For example an exchange can have multiple wallets and split their weight but in reality it can be counted as a single weight if the were to regroup it.
tooltips.telemetry: Metrics from other nodes on the network. All the metrics are collected and averaged to represent different states on the network. P corresponds to percentile, p50 is calculated by excluding the bottom 50% while the p95 is excluding the bottom 5% of the different values to calculate the average.
tooltips.ledgerSize: The total amount of disk space required to store every Paw transactions up to now. The ledger size is calculated on 1024 base not 1000.
tooltips.bandwidthCap: Paw nodes are able to throttle their bandwidth to limit the amount of messages that can be sent or received. 0 means unlimited bandwidth.
tooltips.uptime: Time since the node was last rebooted.
tooltips.pendingTransactionCount: The number of receivable transactions exceeds the displayed limit of {{count}}.
tooltips.mnano: Paw is the current standard division used in wallets, on exchanges and services. It is referred as 1 PAW.
tooltips.versionsByWeight: For a version to be taking over the network's consensus, it needs to have {{onlineWeightQuorumPercent}}% of the online voting weight from a minimum of {{onlineWeightMinimum}} PAW.
tooltips.onChainVolume: The sum of all PAW transactions that have been confirmed on the network. If user A sends 1 PAW and user B receives 1 PAW on the same day, 2 PAW will be added in the daily volume because 2 transactions were broadcasted and confirmed, a send and a receive.
tooltips.pendingTransaction: Funds were sent to this account but the owner has not yet pocketed the funds. Only the owner of the account can write a received transaction into their blockchain. If this is your account, unlock your wallet, the receiving block is usually automatically broadcasted.

search.searchBy: Search by Address / Block / Known Account

preferences.darkModeDetailed: Switch from Light or Dark mode to improve your site browsing experience depending on your environment.
preferences.languageDetailed: Choose desired language. PawTracker is looking for contributors to help improve the explorer's translation. <0>Contribute</0>
preferences.watchDetailed: Watch the price of other cryptocurrencies in the top 100. The current market prices and 24 hours change will appear in the top bar. You may also re-order your selection using drag and drop.
preferences.fiatCurrencyDetailed: Fiat money is government-issued currency. Select a fiat currency to compare Paw's price.
preferences.natriconsDetailed: Pawnimals are animals for Paw addresses.
preferences.liveTransactionsDetailed: Watch live transactions happening on the Paw network. Available on the Home page.

home.bitcoinTransactionFees: Bitcoin transaction fees paid to miners
home.reconnectingToBlockchain: Disconnected, reconnecting to the PAW blockchain
home.cpsLocal: CPS observed on the local node
home.cpsNetwork: Median CPS across several representative nodes

account.notOpenedYet: This account hasn't been opened yet
account.notOpenedYetReason: While the account address is valid, no blocks have been published to its chain yet. If PAW has been sent to this account, it still needs to publish a corresponding block to pocket the funds.
account.missingAccountInfo: The account is not specified in the URL. Use the top search bar for searching for an account or append it in the URL after /account/

block.confirmedStatus: The block is confirmed on the network
block.pendingStatus: The block is not yet confirmed on the network
block.missingBlockInfo: The block is not specified in the URL. Use the top search bar for searching for a block or append it in the URL after /block/
block.blockNotFoundInfo: The block you requested in not found. It is possible that the block is present on the Paw network but has yet to be seen by the node. Make sure you are searching for the correct block or try again later.

representatives.voteDistributionDescription: For visual simplification, only tribes without sub-tribes are shown

faucets.description: Faucets allows you to claim small amounts of PAW for free. These faucets are for you to experience how easy it is to send and receive PAW across the world instantly on a decentralized network.

developerFund.description: Overview over the current Proof-Of-Growth fund.
developerFund.originalDeveloperFundDescription: Used to pay for development. Distribution of Paw is performed monthly and split among all team members. Initial core members received 1.5% each.
developerFund.originalExpenseFundDescription: The expense fund of Paw is used to pay for any occuring bills, for example server listing fees, server bills etc.

largeTransactions.description: Large transactions happening on the PAW blockchain.

distribution.title: Paw Distribution
distribution.summary: Total of <0>{{i18nTotalAccounts}}</0> accounts are holding <1>{{i18nTotalBalances}}</1> PAW
distribution.summaryMinBalance: Any account with a balance inferior to <0>0.001</0> is excluded
distribution.dormantFundsExperiment: This is an experiment to understand how many accounts are active on the Paw blockchain. For each of the {{totalAccounts}} accounts, the last transaction date on the local node is captured. The balance and receivable amounts each account contains is marked as active for the month they last transacted. The following month, the balance and receivable will be marked as dormant.
distribution.dormantFundsQuarterExample: An account which holds 50 PAW and 50 receivable PAW have last transacted 6 months ago (2 quarters), a balance of 100 PAW is added as "dormant" to the total of the following quarter.

status.nodeCount: The average is calculated out of <0>{{nodeCount}}</0> nodes with telemetry enabled.

exchangeTracker.description: Every day a capture of the account balances of the most popular exchanges where Paw is traded is taken. This measurement can be used to analyze movements and fluctuations on the network.

social.title: Cryptocurrencies social engagement / $1 Billion in Market Cap

preferences.description: Manage your preferences for every sections. The preferences are stored on the browser, if you clear your data your preferences will be back to defaults.
preferences.filterTransactionsRangeDetailed: Choose to only display incoming transactions within a certain min / max range of the sent or received amount.
preferences.connectionDetailed: Connect the explorer to another node than PawLooker
